meanings.definition: Lacking courage or determination; timid or fearful.
meanings.sent1: The boy was the wussiest in the class, always afraid of trying new things.
meanings.sent2: She felt like the wussiest person in the room when asked to speak in front of the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The wussiest squirrel in the park would run away at the sight of a tiny butterfly.
meanings.sent4: Compared to the brave lion, the wussiest mouse seemed like a giant coward.
meanings.sent5: His wussiest behavior during the storm left everyone surprised at his lack of bravery.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of strength or toughness; weak or feeble.
meanings.sent1: The wussiest excuse for not finishing the race was blaming a shoelace.
meanings.sent2: The team's performance was the wussiest they had ever displayed on the field.
meanings.sent3: The wussiest kitten in the litter struggled to carry even the smallest toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her wussiest attempt at lifting the heavy box ended with a loud crash.
meanings.sent5: The wussiest bridge in the game collapsed under the weight of a single toy car.
